(59) 64th CONCLUSIONS, MINUTE 4.Confidential Annex.INVASION OP THE CHANCELLOR OP THE EXCHEQUER enquiredGREAT BRITAIN.whether adequate steps were being taken to safeguardaerodromes, for example by the strengthening ofgarrisons, and the erection of barbed wire.THE DEPUTY CHIEF OF THE AIR STAFF said thatthe attention of the authorities at aerodromes hadbeen particularly directed to the danger of parachutelandings.THE FIRST LORD OF THE ADMIRALTY suggestedthat a very suitable place for a landing would be theLondon parks, and thought that the dispositions ofthe troops in London .should be reviewed, and themeasures for the safeguarding of vulnerable objectives,; such as, for example, Government Offices, should be strengthened.THE DEPUTY CHIEF OF THE IMPERIAL GENERALSTAFF said that these matters were receiving theattention of the Commander-in-Chief, Home Forces, as aU?/k^9)(.S result of the War Cabinet Conclusion mentioned in the margin.The War Cabinet took note of the above statements.
